Home Reviews About Photos Posts Community See more of Sigcse Technical Symposium 2021 on Facebook Log In or Create New Account See more of Sigcse Technical Symposium 2021 on Facebook Log In Forgot account? or Create New Account Not Now Visitor Posts Becky Bates March 20 at 6:49 PM Here are the books and stories for  # SIGCSEReads  this coming year:

W ... e have two excellent short stories that bring new voices into our mix: “Welcome to Your Authentic Indian Experience(TM)” by Rebecca Roanhorse and “Poems and Distant Lands” by Gu Shi (translated by Ken Liu). 

By popular vote, we have Parable of the Sower by Octavia E. Butler.

For our non-fiction option, we are looking back at some of the history of computing with a memoir: Think Black by Clyde W. Ford. 

We hope you enjoy these at some point in the coming year.  If you want other suggestions, you can find what we read in past years here:   https://sigcse.org/…/resourc…/reads.html .   See More Bettina Bair March 15 at 6:52 AM The SIGCSE Technical Symposium has started. Did you find and downloa ... d your Free Drink ticket yet?  Sigcse Technical Symposium 2021   See More UNH Manchester February 2 at 7:42 AM Computer science faculty Mihaela Sabin and Karen Jin have had their  ... research accepted at the  Sigcse Technical Symposium 2021 , the largest computing education conference worldwide. Congratulations, professors! We'll give you session highlights, conference updates, and speak to members of the community. The Android app for the symposium is now live in the Google Play store:    https://play.google.com/store/apps/details…  An iOS app is coming soon, and we'll let you know when it's out. SIGCSE 2021 Sigcse Technical Symposium 2021 March 1  ·  The Pathable site for  # SIGCSE2021  is live! Check your email for login information and start planning your schedule! Sigcse Technical Symposium 2021 February 22  ·  Have you checked out the great workshops at  # SIGCSE2021 ? There are three sessions of workshops on Saturday and Sunday. Sigcse Technical Symposium 2021 February 19  ·  Platinum Supporter Google has tools that can be used both in the classroom and to support CS Ed research. Sigcse Technical Symposium 2021 February 15  ·  Thank you to Platinum Sponsor GitHub Education!  http://education.github.com  Make a plan to check out their sessions Tuesday, March 16 and Thursday March 18 both at 3:00 PM (ET). Learn how to use GitHub in the classroom and for undergraduate research!
